sentence.Network_en: At the door was a neatly dressed, dignified man.
sentence.Network_cn: 门口站着一位穿戴整齐、仪态庄重的男子。

sentence.Network_en: It was a technique later dignified by the term "info-tainment".
sentence.Network_cn: 那种技术后来被美其名曰“资讯娱乐”。

sentence.Network_en: He seemed a very dignified and charming man.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看上去很高贵，富有魅力。

the palatial dignified construction main body , is located in carpet of green grass , the flowers and trees luxuriant Zhongshan Park , becomes east Taibei an area radiant star ;巍峨庄严的建筑本体，座落在绿草如茵，花木扶疏的中山公园，成为台北东区一颗璀璨的明星；

entry.tran: 有尊严的;庄严的;高贵的
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is dignified, you mean they are calm, impressive and deserve respect.

example.ex: He seemed a very dignified and charming man...
example.tran: 他看上去很高贵，富有魅力。

example.ex: Mr Smith is maintaining a dignified silence.
example.tran: 史密斯先生庄重地保持着沉默。

means.word_mean: 1. having or expressing dignity; especially formality or stateliness in bearing or appearance;

sentences.sentence: "the director of the school was a dignified white-haired gentleman"

auth_sentence.content: But living with such capriciousness hardly represents a dignified existence.

sentences.en: He always strikes such a dignified pose before his girlfriend.
sentences.cn: 他总是在女友面前摆出这种庄严的姿态。
